      • Game

        public Game(uniChess.Player player1,
    uniChess.Player player2,
    java.lang.String gameString)
        Creates a new Game between the supplied players starting from the gamestate supplied through the gameString. This allows a game to be continued from a specific state. (See getGameString method).
        Parameters:
        player1 - The first player
        player2 - The second player
        gameString - The series of moves to be performed before the game starts.

      • Game

        public Game(uniChess.Player player1,
    uniChess.Player player2)
        Creates a Game between the supplied players. One player must have a Color of Game.Color.WHITE and one must have a Color of Game.Color.BLACK.
        Parameters:
        player1 - The first player
        player2 - The second player

    • Method Detail

      • getGameString

        public java.lang.String getGameString()
        Returns the moves made (in algebraic notation) so far in the game, separated by commas. The resulting string can be used to make a new Game object that will repeat the moves outlined in this String upon creation.
        Returns:
        The game string

      • advance

        public Game.GameEvent advance(java.lang.String in)

        Attempts to advance the game by one move specified by the supplied algebraic notation string. If the move is valid, legal, and does not put the other player in check, checkmate, or stalemate, then this method will perform the move, add the newly generated board the the board list, and switch the current player, and return GameEvent.OK. Otherwise, it will return the GameEvent type associated with the corresponding event.

        If the returned value is GameEvent.ILLEGAL, GameEvent.INVALID, or GameEvent.AMBIGUOUS then the game was not successfully advanced and the turn still needs to be completed with a valid move.

        GameEvent.DRAW will be returned only when the draw field of each Player is true. Since there is no standard convention for Draws, how this is implemented is up to the developer.

        Parameters:
        in - The algebraic notation move
        Returns:
        The player who moved last.

      • playerHasCheck

        public boolean playerHasCheck(uniChess.Board board,
                     uniChess.Player player)
        Determines whether a given player on a given board holds check.
        Parameters:
        board - the board to check on
        player - the player to check for
        Returns:
        Whether the player has check

      • getLegalMoves

        public java.util.List<uniChess.Move> getLegalMoves(uniChess.Board board,

        Returns a list of moves that are legal on a given board for a given player.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
